data.name: Dummy Epoch - find the gap
data.description:
# Dummy Epoch

Epoch time is the way that computers store time/date stamps - usually a number of milliseconds since a certain moment (1 Jan 1970).

In this kata, we will build our own function to generate an epoch like timestamp generically (i.e. from any date).

The function should return the *number of completed units* between epoch start and the given date.

Your function must take three arguments:
1. date from which epoch starts (a string 'yyyy-mm-dd') where 'mm' is '01' for January
2. unit of time which we are counting (a string 'q' for quarters, 'm' for months, 'w' for weeks or 'd' for days)
3. date which we need to calculate epoch for

The function must support dates before 'epoch' (by returning negative numbers). Any date before epoch would be negative - so if epoch was 1/1/2019, then 31/12/2018 would be -1, and 31/11/2018 would be -2, and so on.

Months are defined as the period from the xth day of a month to the xth day of the next month. Quarters are defined as 3 months.

For example, if our start date was 2018-01-01, and our unit was months:
```
2018-01-01: 0
2018-02-01: 1
2017-12-29: -1
```

HINT: days and weeks are always the same amount of time. Months and quarters are not.
